pullRequest.body:
---
<!-- The text above the `---` will become the commit message when your
PR is merged. Please leave a blank newline before the `---`, otherwise
GitHub will format the text above it as a title.

To indicate co-authors, include lines at the bottom of the commit message
(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Co-authored-by: Author Name <author@email.com>

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

If this PR depends on other PRs, please list them below this comment,
using the following format:
- [ ] depends on: #abc [optional extra text]
- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]
-->

nodes.body:
Here are some additional tests I'd written before I noticed your PR. The numbers don't need to be quite so big, but I copied them from a GCD test.
```
example : 2 ∣ 4 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ 2 ∣ 5 := by norm_num1
example : 553105253 ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ 553105253 ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 + 1 := by norm_num1

example : (2 : ℤ) ∣ 4 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ (2 : ℤ) ∣ 5 := by norm_num1
example : (553105253 : ℤ) ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ (553105253 : ℤ) ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 + 1 := by norm_num1
```

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6953073990/job/18917665629)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6953073990/job/18917665412)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/6953073990/job/18917665215)
Doesn't "we trust" here mean "we assert that"?
yes, this comment is copy-pasted and seems wrong
What's the heuristic for using `nat_lit` vs `OfNat.ofNat` or just `0`?
Using simpler terms means less work for the kernel, which is going to be normalizing the LHS to a nat literal.
No, it wasn't, I didn't realise I did that (nor did I make the edit manually...)

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: add div/mod/dvd on Nat/Int to `norm_num`

source.title: feat: norm num extension for Nat and Int divisibility

nodes.body:
Here are some additional tests I'd written before I noticed your PR. The numbers don't need to be quite so big, but I copied them from a GCD test.
```
example : 2 ∣ 4 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ 2 ∣ 5 := by norm_num1
example : 553105253 ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ 553105253 ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 + 1 := by norm_num1

example : (2 : ℤ) ∣ 4 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ (2 : ℤ) ∣ 5 := by norm_num1
example : (553105253 : ℤ) ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 := by norm_num1
example : ¬ (553105253 : ℤ) ∣ 553105253 * 776531401 + 1 := by norm_num1
```
